# Patient Data Security & Compliance SLA

## 1. Introduction

This Service Level Agreement ("SLA") defines the security and compliance terms for handling patient data in accordance with healthcare regulations. The Provider agrees to implement and maintain the security controls specified herein to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of protected health information (PHI).

## 2. Compliance Standards

### 2.1 Regulatory Compliance

The Provider shall comply with all applicable healthcare regulations including:

- Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)
- Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act (HITECH)
- General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for European patients
- State-specific healthcare privacy laws
- FDA regulations for medical devices and software as a medical device (SaMD)

### 2.2 Certification and Audits

The Provider shall maintain:

- Annual HIPAA compliance audit certification
- SOC 2 Type II attestation with healthcare addendum
- HITRUST CSF certification
- ISO 27001 certification with focus on healthcare controls

## 3. Security Controls

### 3.1 Data Encryption

- All PHI must be encrypted at rest using AES-256 encryption
- All PHI in transit must use TLS 1.2 or higher with FIPS-compliant cipher suites
- Encryption key management must follow NIST 800-57 guidelines
- Database-level column encryption for sensitive fields

### 3.2 Access Control

- Role-based access control (RBAC) with principle of least privilege
- Multi-factor authentication for all access to PHI
- Automatic account lockout after 5 failed attempts
- Privileged access management with just-in-time access
- Quarterly access reviews and recertification

### 3.3 Audit Logging

- Comprehensive audit logging of all PHI access and modification
- Immutable audit trails preserved for 7 years
- Real-time alerting for suspicious access patterns
- Log retention compliant with applicable regulations

## 4. Data Protection

### 4.1 Backup and Recovery

- Encrypted backups of all PHI performed daily
- Backup verification testing weekly
- 30-day backup retention minimum (or longer per regulatory requirements)
- Geographic separation of backup storage
- Recovery Time Objective (RTO): 2 hours
- Recovery Point Objective (RPO): 15 minutes

### 4.2 Data Segregation

- Logical separation of PHI between customers
- Physical separation of production and non-production environments
- Data masking and de-identification in non-production environments

## 5. Incident Response

### 5.1 Security Incident Management

| Severity | Definition | Response Time | Resolution Target | Notification |
|----------|------------|---------------|-------------------|-------------|
| Critical | Confirmed breach of PHI | 15 minutes | 2 hours | 1 hour |
| High | Potential unauthorized access to PHI | 30 minutes | 4 hours | 2 hours |
| Medium | Security vulnerability with potential impact | 2 hours | 8 hours | 4 hours |
| Low | Minor policy violation with no PHI exposure | 8 hours | 24 hours | Daily summary |

### 5.2 Breach Notification

- Provider will notify Customer of any security incidents involving PHI within the timeframes specified above
- Provider will assist with regulatory breach notification requirements
- Provider will provide forensic evidence and investigation results

## 6. Vendor Management

- All subcontractors with potential access to PHI must be approved by Customer
- Business Associate Agreements (BAAs) required for all subcontractors
- Annual security assessment of all subcontractors
- Provider maintains liability for subcontractor compliance

## 7. Compliance Reporting

### 7.1 Regular Reporting

The Provider shall provide the following reports:

- Monthly security and compliance dashboard
- Quarterly risk assessment updates
- Annual comprehensive security assessment
- Ad-hoc penetration testing results

### 7.2 Compliance Documentation

The Provider shall maintain and make available upon request:

- HIPAA security risk assessments
- Evidence of security control implementation
- Training records for staff with PHI access
- Documentation of security incident responses

## 8. Penalties for Non-Compliance

Failure to meet the security and compliance standards specified in this SLA will result in:

| Violation | Penalty |
|-----------|--------|
| Minor compliance gap with no PHI exposure | 5% of monthly fee |
| Moderate compliance gap with potential risk | 15% of monthly fee |
| Major compliance failure | 50% of monthly fee |
| PHI breach due to Provider negligence | 100% of monthly fee plus breach costs |

## 9. Continuous Monitoring

- 24/7/365 security monitoring and threat detection
- Vulnerability scanning performed weekly
- Penetration testing performed quarterly
- Security patching within defined SLAs:
  - Critical: 24 hours
  - High: 72 hours
  - Medium: 1 week
  - Low: 30 days
